items.place_of_birth: Mong Cai, Quang Ninh Province, North Vietnam
items.title: HUNG TIEN PHAM
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $30,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of Hung Tien Pham.
items.remarks: Pham is known to have traveled to Canada, China, Vietnam, Thailand, and Hong Kong. He also has ties to Boston, Massachusetts; Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; Chicago, Illinois; Toronto, Canada; and the San Francisco Bay area of California. His last known location was Bangkok, Thailand, in the mid-to-late 1990s. Pham was known to be a big spender who liked flashy cars and cognac.
items.caution:
Hung Tien Pham is wanted for his alleged involvement in the execution-style murders of five men at a Chinatown social club in Boston, Massachusetts, on January 12, 1991, known locally as the Boston Chinatown Massacre. In the early morning hours, Pham, a known associate of the Ping On crime syndicate, allegedly entered an illegal gambling den located at 85A Tyler Street in Boston, Massachusetts, and allegedly shot six men, execution-style, while they were playing cards. Of the six victims, only one survived the attack. On January 18, 1991, a local arrest warrant was issued for Pham by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, Suffolk County, after he was indicted by a grand jury in Suffolk County Superior Court on five counts of murder, one count of armed assault with intent to murder, one count of conspiracy, and one count of carrying a firearm without a license.

Following the massacre, Pham went to New York City, New York, and boarded a flight to Hong Kong on February 1, 1991. A federal arrest warrant was issued for Pham by the United States District Court, District of Massachusetts, Boston, Massachusetts, on February 15, 1991, after he was charged with unlawful flight to avoid prosecution.
items.description: Unlawful Flight to Avoid Prosecution - Murder (Five Counts), Armed Assault with Intent to Murder (One Count), Conspiracy (One Count), Carrying a Firearm Without a License (One Count)
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS AND AN INTERNATIONAL FLIGHT RISK

items.details:
On February 6, 2007, the Sarasota County Sheriff’s Office (SCSO), Florida, discovered the partial skeletal remains of an unidentified white female in a wooded area on Ashton Court in Sarasota, Florida. Please note that the pictures above are facial sketches depicting what the victim may have looked like, not actual photographs of the victim.

The skeletal analysis completed on the remains indicated that the victim may have fractured her nose and right wrist at some point in her life. At the time the victim was discovered her long reddish brown hair was pulled back into a pony-tail. The victim also had breast implants. The victim appeared to have been wearing a multi-colored cotton pullover shirt with an Italian label, a light colored “Spice Wear” skirt with a leather string belt, and turquoise socks at the time of her death.
items.title: JANE DOE - SARASOTA, FLORIDA
items.description:
Sarasota, Florida
February 6, 2007

items.place_of_birth: Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea)
items.title: JON CHANG HYOK
items.remarks: Jon is a North Korean citizen last known to be in North Korea. Jon has traveled to China in the past and has reported a date of birth in 1989.
items.caution:
Jon Chang Hyok is allegedly a state-sponsored North Korean hacker who is part of an alleged criminal conspiracy responsible for some of the costliest computer intrusions in history. These intrusions caused damage to computer systems of, and stole currency and virtual currency from, numerous victims.

Jon was alleged to be a participant in a wide-ranging criminal conspiracy undertaken by a group of hackers of the North Korean government’s Reconnaissance General Bureau (RGB). The conspiracy comprised North Korean hacking groups that some private cybersecurity researchers have labeled the “Lazarus Group” and Advanced Persistent Threat 38 (APT38). For his part in the conspiracy, Jon is alleged to have been directly involved in the development and dissemination of malicious cryptocurrency applications targeting numerous cryptocurrency exchanges and other companies. On December 8, 2020, a federal arrest warrant was issued for Jon in the United States District Court, Central District of California, after he was charged with one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud and bank fraud, and one count of conspiracy to commit computer fraud (computer intrusions).
items.description: Conspiracy to Commit Wire Fraud and Bank Fraud; Conspiracy to Commit Computer-Related Fraud (Computer Intrusion)

items.place_of_birth: Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (North Korea)
items.title: KIM IL
items.remarks: Kim is a North Korean citizen last known to be in North Korea. Kim has traveled to Singapore and Russia in the past and has reported a date of birth in 1994.
items.caution:
Kim Il is allegedly a state-sponsored North Korean hacker who is part of an alleged criminal conspiracy responsible for some of the costliest computer intrusions in history. These intrusions caused damage to computer systems of, and stole currency and virtual currency from, numerous victims.

Kim was alleged to be a participant in a wide-ranging criminal conspiracy undertaken by a group of hackers of the North Korean government’s Reconnaissance General Bureau (RGB). The conspiracy comprised North Korean hacking groups that some private cybersecurity researchers have labeled the “Lazarus Group” and Advanced Persistent Threat 38 (APT38). For his part in the conspiracy, Kim is alleged to have been directly involved in the development and dissemination of a malicious cryptocurrency application, in cyber-enabled heists from financial institutions, and in the Marine Chain initial coin offering. On December 8, 2020, a federal arrest warrant was issued for Kim in the United States District Court, Central District of California, after he was charged with one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud and bank fraud, and one count of conspiracy to commit computer fraud (computer intrusions).
items.description: Conspiracy to Commit Wire Fraud and Bank Fraud; Conspiracy to Commit Computer-Related Fraud (Computer Intrusion)

items.place_of_birth: Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea)
items.title: PARK JIN HYOK
items.remarks: Park is a North Korean citizen last known to be in North Korea. Park has traveled to China in the past and has reported dates of birth in 1984 and 1981.
items.caution:
Park Jin Hyok is allegedly a state-sponsored North Korean computer programmer who is part of an alleged criminal conspiracy responsible for some of the costliest computer intrusions in history. These intrusions caused damage to computer systems of, and stole currency and virtual currency from, numerous victims.

Park was alleged to be a participant in a wide-ranging criminal conspiracy undertaken by a group of hackers of the North Korean government’s Reconnaissance General Bureau (RGB). The conspiracy comprised North Korean hacking groups that some private cybersecurity researchers have labeled the “Lazarus Group” and Advanced Persistent Threat 38 (APT38). On December 8, 2020, a federal arrest warrant was issued for Park in the United States District Court, Central District of California, after he was charged with one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud and bank fraud, and one count of conspiracy to commit computer fraud (computer intrusions). A federal arrest warrant was previously issued for Park on June 8, 2018, after he was charged with one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud and one count of conspiracy to commit computer-related fraud (computer intrusion) in a federal criminal complaint.
items.description: Conspiracy to Commit Wire Fraud and Bank Fraud; Conspiracy to Commit Computer-Related Fraud (Computer Intrusion)

items.details:
Cynthia Carver was reported missing on February 22, 2019, to the Southampton County Sheriff's Office. She was last seen on Thomaston Road in Newsoms, Virginia, at approximately 9:00 p.m., on February 21st. She was also seen running various errands in the Norfolk area earlier in the day. Evidence at her home on Everett Street in Newsoms suggested she may have been abducted, and her body was recovered on March 19, 2019, in the southern area of Suffolk, Virginia.

The case is being investigated jointly by the FBI and Southampton County Sheriff's Office.
items.title: DEATH INVESTIGATION
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $5,000 for information leading to the arrest, prosecution, and conviction of the person(s) responsible for Cynthia's death.
items.description:
Cynthia Michelle Carver
February 21, 2019
Newsoms, Virginia

items.details: The Federal Bureau of Investigation's Denver Field Office, Durango Resident Agency, is seeking the public’s assistance in identifying the unknown individual(s) responsible for the murder of Avery Whiteskunk. The victim was reported missing on January 31, 2004. On March 19, 2004, Whiteskunk’s body was found on the northern edge of the Ute Mountain Ute Indian Reservation, near County Road G in Montezuma County, Colorado. Whiteskunk was from Towaoc, Colorado.
items.title: AVERY WHITESKUNK
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the individual(s) responsible for the murder of Avery Whiteskunk.
items.description:
Murder Victim
January 31, 2004 (Reported missing)
Montezuma County, Colorado

items.details:
The FBI is seeking information regarding an armed pharmacy burglary that occurred on June 2, 2020, at Walgreens, located at 5400 New Cut Road, Louisville, Kentucky.

On June 2, 2020, at approximately 2:28 A.M., numerous individuals entered the Walgreens by forcefully breaking into the front of the store. At least one individual was armed with a handgun. The subjects spent several minutes inside the store during the burglary before leaving on foot and in vehicles. At least one of the subjects used a firearm to shoot rounds into the pharmacy. The subjects stole a large amount of Walgreens merchandise, which included controlled substances, and caused significant property damage.
items.title: COMMERCIAL BURGLARY - KENTUCKY
items.description:
Louisville, Kentucky
June 2, 2020

items.details:
In the early morning hours of April 9, 2020, the Etz Chayim Synagogue, located at 7705 Bailey Cove Road, Huntsville, Alabama, was vandalized with anti-Semitic graffiti. The following day, in the early morning hours of April 10, 2020, the Chabad of Huntsville, located at 1908 Parkhill Road SE, Huntsville, Alabama, was vandalized with similar anti-Semitic graffiti. Surveillance camera footage indicated the vandalisms were perpetrated by the same individual. The individual walked with a pronounced, distinct limp and appeared to have a prosthetic left leg. The individual may have been driving an early model Toyota Prius, light in color. Prior to the vandalizations, on April 4, 2020, the individual was seen walking on residential streets near the Chabad of Huntsville in the Blossomwood neighborhood.

The FBI’s Birmingham Field Office and the Huntsville Police Department are attempting to identify the individual responsible for the damage to these religious properties. Damage exceeding $5,000 to religious property is a felony offense.
items.title: VANDALISM OF HUNTSVILLE SYNAGOGUES
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $15,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the individual responsible for the vandalizations of synagogues in Huntsville, Alabama.
items.description:
Huntsville, Alabama
April 2020

items.details:
The FBI is seeking information regarding an armed pharmacy burglary that occurred on June 2, 2020, at Walgreens, located at 5201 S 3rd Street, Louisville, Kentucky.

On June 2, 2020, at approximately 3:53 A.M., several individuals entered the Walgreens by forcefully breaking into the pharmacy drive-through window. At least one individual was armed with a handgun. The subjects spent several minutes inside the pharmacy during the burglary before leaving on foot and in vehicles. The subjects stole approximately $20,000 worth of prescriptions, including some controlled substances.
items.title: COMMERCIAL BURGLARY - KENTUCKY

images.caption: Subject is thought to be wearing light purple latex gloves

items.description:
Louisville, Kentucky
June 2, 2020

items.details: The FBI’s Denver Field Office is seeking the public’s assistance in identifying the unknown individual(s) responsible for the murder of Odell Vest in July 2000. On approximately July 10 or 11, 2000, the victim was last seen in a residence located on Lafayette Street, Towaoc, Colorado, where a house party was taking place.
items.title: ODELL VEST
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the individual(s) responsible for the murder of Odell Vest.
items.remarks: Vest was not known to travel and did not have a driver's license.
items.description:
Murder Victim
Towaoc, Colorado
July 2000

items.title: LOUIS SAM WYENA
items.remarks: Louis Sam Wyena may visit or have ties to the Yakama Nation Indian Reservation, Columbia River in-lieu sites.
items.caution:
Louis Sam Wyena is wanted for his alleged involvement in the violent assault of an intimate partner, which resulted in substantial bodily injury to the victim in White Swan, Washington. The incident occurred in December of 2019.

On August 18, 2020, a federal arrest warrant was issued for Louis Sam Wyena in the United States District Court, Eastern District of Washington, Spokane, Washington, after he was charged with the aforementioned crime.
items.description: Assault Resulting in Substantial Bodily Injury to a Spouse or Intimate Partner

items.details:
The FBI's Albuquerque Field Office and the Zuni Police Department in New Mexico are seeking the public's assistance in finding the person(s) responsible for the death of Jolynn Marie Calavaza.


On May 4, 2020, Calavaza's body was found in a vacant lot in Zuni Pueblo, New Mexico. An autopsy determined Calavaza had died of multiple stab wounds. Calavaza was 46 years old at the time of her death.
items.title: JOLYNN MARIE CALAVAZA
items.remarks: Calavaza lived in Zuni Pueblo, New Mexico.
items.description:
Homicide Victim
Zuni Pueblo, New Mexico
May 4, 2020

items.suspects:
During the course of the investigation, evidence has led investigators to believe the suspect, displayed in the composite sketch, is involved in the murder of Joette "JoJo" Malone.

The person depicted in the composite sketch is described as a Black male, approximately 16 to 25 years old, with a thin build, black hair and brown eyes.
items.details:
The Federal Bureau of Investigation's Indianapolis Field Office, along with the Hammond Police Department in Indiana, are seeking the public's assistance in identifying the unknown individual(s) responsible for the murder of Joette "JoJo" Malone on July 29, 2020.

JoJo, who was 2 years old at the time of her death, was seated in the back seat of her mother’s vehicle when she was shot on July 29, 2020, at approximately 9:30 p.m. The vehicle was parked in the parking lot at the Kennedy Crossing apartment complex in Hammond, Indiana. The vehicle appeared to have its rear driver’s side window shot out. JoJo was flown by helicopter to a children’s hospital in Chicago, Illinois, where she later died from the injuries sustained in the shooting.
items.title: JOETTE "JOJO" MALONE
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $15,000 for information leading to the identification and arrest of the individual(s) responsible for the homicide of Joette "JoJo" Malone.
items.description:
Homicide Victim
Hammond, Indiana
July 29, 2020

items.title: JOSHUA ANIEFIOK AWAK
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the identification and arrest of Joshua Aniefiok Awak.
items.remarks: Awak has previously resided in Nigeria and Los Angeles, California.
items.caution:
Joshua Aniefiok Awak is wanted for his alleged involvement in a money-laundering conspiracy resulting in the transfer of at least $6 million in fraudulently obtained funds - and the attempted theft of at least $40 million.

Awak and other members of a cyber-criminal network allegedly laundered the proceeds of fraud schemes through bank accounts in the United States and across the world. The fraudulent schemes involved business email compromise, escrow fraud, romance scams, and other online fraud schemes.

On June 27, 2019, a grand jury in the United States District Court, Central District of California, indicted Awak and a federal warrant was issued for his arrest. Awak was charged federally with conspiracy to engage in money laundering; conspiracy to commit wire fraud, mail fraud, and bank fraud; wire fraud; money laundering; and aggravated identity theft.
items.description: Conspiracy to Engage in Money Laundering; Conspiracy to Commit Wire Fraud, Mail Fraud, and Bank Fraud; Wire Fraud; Money Laundering; Aggravated Identity Theft
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED AN INTERNATIONAL FLIGHT RISK

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest of Ruben Adner Pacheco-Santiago.
items.caution: Ruben Adner Pacheco-Santiago is wanted for allegedly being a felon in possession of a weapon. On November 19, 2020, Pacheco-Santiago was stopped in a vehicle by the Police of Puerto Rico in Villa Fontana, Carolina, Puerto Rico. At that time, he allegedly fired a handgun at an officer and then fled the scene. Pacheco is a convicted felon and was on probation at the time of the traffic stop. A federal arrest warrant was issued for Pacheco-Santiago on December 3, 2020, in the United States District Court, District of Puerto Rico, San Juan, Puerto Rico, after he was charged with being a felon in possession of a firearm.
items.scars_and_marks: Pacheco-Santiago has tattoos on his finger and left wrist.
items.title: RUBEN ADNER PACHECO-SANTIAGO
items.description: Felon in Possession of a Firearm
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS

items.details:
On the afternoon of February 12, 2021, the Henry County Sheriff's Office in Virginia received a report of a missing 12-year-old female identified as Allie Michelle Broadaway from Bassett, Virginia. It is believed that Broadaway met 21-year-old Kaleb Christopher Merritt of Spring, Texas, on a social media platform and Merritt traveled to Virginia thereafter. Merritt is known to have camped out in the woods behind Broadaway's residence prior to her disappearance. It is believed that the two are together and that Broadaway is in extreme danger. Merritt and Broadaway may be traveling in a 2000 Mercury Grand Marquis, light green in color, with Texas plates, DMP-2294.

The Henry County Sheriff's Office has obtained an arrest warrant for Merritt charging him with abduction. This matter is currently being investigated by the Henry County Sheriff's Office, the Virginia State Police, and the FBI's Richmond Field Office.
items.remarks: Allie was last known to be wearing a grey James Madison University (JMU) sweatshirt and dark fleece pants.
items.title: ALLIE MICHELLE BROADAWAY
items.description:
February 12, 2021
Bassett, Virginia

items.details:
The FBI’s Violent Crimes Task Force is asking for the public’s assistance to help identify the “Jeepers Bandits,” four men who allegedly committed six armed robberies in Phoenix and Glendale, Arizona, since November 27, 2020.

During the robberies, the suspects enter the businesses and approach the counter, acting as if they are customers. They wait for other customers to leave, then two of the suspects pull out guns and point them at employees. The suspects demand money be placed into a bag, then they leave. The four men target mostly smoke shops but have also robbed a Cold Stone Creamery.

No one has been injured during these robberies.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS
items.title: ARMED ROBBERIES – “JEEPERS BANDITS”
items.suspects:
Suspect one is described as a Hispanic male, 20 to 25 years old, 5’6” to 5’8” and 200 to 220 pounds, with a stocky build and black hair. He has worn a baseball hat, blue sweatshirt or black t-shirt with “Metallica” on the front, a face mask and clear latex gloves. He is armed with a black handgun.

Suspect two is described as a White male, 20 to 25 years old, 5’9” to 6'0", 160 to 170 pounds, with a thin build and brown hair. He has worn a baseball hat, an American flag gaiter-style mask and orange gloves. He is armed with a black handgun.

Suspect three is described as a Hispanic male with black hair, early 20s, approximately 5’10”, and approximately 160 pounds. He wore red shoes, jeans and a Broncos’ sweatshirt.

Suspect four is described as a Hispanic male with black hair in his early 20s. He is 5’8” to 5’10”, and approximately 225 pounds. He has worn a red University of Arizona sweatshirt, blue shorts, and an American flag mask.
items.description:
Phoenix and Glendale, Arizona 
November to December 2020

items.details: Dawnita Wilkerson was last seen on June 21, 2020, at 8:16 p.m., at a local Evansville, Indiana, motel getting into a silver/pewter-colored 2016 Chevy Suburban. (Photo displayed above.) Dawnita’s phone was shut off by the next morning. Her family reported her missing when she didn’t call her mother or her daughters, as she usually did. Dawnita has several medical conditions that require medication that she is without.
items.weight: 145 pounds (At the time of her disappearance)
items.title: DAWNITA WILKERSON
items.scars_and_marks: Dawnita Wilkerson has multiple tattoos, including a heart on her lower back, praying hands with the name "Timmy" on her upper-right shoulder, and a cross on her upper-left shoulder.
items.description:
June 21, 2020 
Evansville, Indiana
